result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Krezinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Counseling deemed necessary  The court orders the defendant to have his fingerprints taken at WRPD

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Defendant David W Krezinski in court with attorney Travis S Slattery.  Defendant David W Krezinski in custody.  Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
and Witness List
Jury trial - 12 person on May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Not guilty pleas entered.    Bond continued

2:19 Defendant David W Krezinski in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Defendant David W Krezinski in custody.  Elizabeth Ruth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Andrew Dewitt is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with WRPD.  Testifies to speaking with Probation Agent Jennifer Spath regarding a burglary at 2711 5th St S, Wis Rapids.  Krezinski lives in adjoining duplex.  Testifies to Spath's concerns.  Pictures were taken of clothing Krezinski was wearing.  Owner's identified clothing in photos as theirs.  Testifies to reviewing initial investigation.  Testifies to phone conversation reviewed between Bianca Lee and David Krezinski.  Testifies to conversation with Bianca Lee regarding burglary.  Testifies to items found during execution of search warrant.  No one had consent to enter property of Martinez and Espinoza. Identifies David Krezinski in the courtroom.  Testifies to damage done to residence to gain entry during burglary.  

Atty Slattery cross examines the witness.  No one saw Krezinski in area during burglary.  There are items of clothing that were taken and are not accounted for.  Lee provided him with a name of someone who may have committed the burglary.  Spoke with individual and determined that he was not a part of the burglary.  Describes location of footprints but was unable to link them to Krezinski.

Redirect by Atty Constable.  Recross by Atty Slattery.  

Court finds probable cause and proceeds to ARGN.  


  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 7, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
No contact with victims or their residences.
No contact w/victims or their residences
Defendant David W Krezinski in court, in custody.  Craig Steven Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
